A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: I would like to subscribe to “Rian Johnson’s Star Wars Universe” please. Time will only prove how ridiculously short-sighted and obtuse those naysayers are currently being about the unique and surprisingly dark themes that are introduced into the franchise’s 8th film\, (not counting Rogue One obviously as it’s not within the “Saga” canon). Anyway\, I can’t wait to see Abraham’s Episode IX in Dec 2019\, which has already been confirmed to be something different from The Force Awakens\, as JJ had to use that film not only to introduce new characters while picking up where we the old ones were\, but he had to undo all of the damage that three prequel films did - those prequels somehow didn’t completely destroy the franchise\, and I am thankful Abrahams was up to the task of picking up those pieces; must’ve been a hell of a challenge. Well\, “Brick” and “Looper” writer/director Rian Johnson swung for the fences here by being himself: by introducing ideas and aspects of the Star Wars plot that had never been entertained or featured before now. That’s kind of a major deal\, especially when it’s done so brilliantly.
